      • connect

        public rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> connect(OperationTimeout timeout)
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Attempts to create a gatt connection to the peripheral.

        Does nothing if there is already an active connection.

        Yields an ConnectionStateException if called when peripheral connection status is changing.

        Specified by:
        connect in interface GattPeripheral
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the connect operation.

        Important: The order in which you connect and create bonds depends on the device's Android version. GattPeripheral.createBond() for more info.

      • disconnect

        public rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> disconnect()
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Ends the gatt connection of the peripheral.

        Does nothing if the peripheral is already disconnected.

        Yields a ConnectionStateException if the peripheral is currently connecting.

        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface GattPeripheral

      • createBond

        public rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> createBond()
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Creates a bond to the peripheral from the current device.

        Does nothing if the device is already bonded.

        Important: the behavior of this method varies depending on the device's Android version. In API levels 18 and 19 (JB and KitKat), this method can only be called if the GattPeripheral is currently connected.

        However, starting in API level 21 (Lollipop), this method will fail if you call it when the device is connected. If you need a bond, you should call this method before you call GattPeripheral.connect(OperationTimeout).

        Specified by:
        createBond in interface GattPeripheral

      • removeBond

        public rx.Observable<GattPeripheral> removeBond(OperationTimeout timeout)
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Removes any bond to the peripheral from the current device. Does nothing if the device is not bonded.

        Note: this method does not exhibit the same inconsistent behavior that GattPeripheral.createBond() does between device Android versions.

        Specified by:
        removeBond in interface GattPeripheral
        Parameters:
        timeout - The timeout to apply to the operation.
        See Also:
        The current implementation of this method depends on the existence of a private method on {@code BluetoothDevice}, and may stop functioning in a future release of Android. Tested through API level 23.

        public rx.Observable<GattService> discoverService(java.util.UUID serviceIdentifier,
                                                  OperationTimeout timeout)
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Performs service discovery on the peripheral, yielding the service matching a given identifier.

        If the service cannot be found, this method will yield a ServiceDiscoveryException.

        Yields a ConnectionStateException if the peripheral is not connected when this method is called.

        Specified by:
        discoverService in interface GattPeripheral

      • writeCommand

        public rx.Observable<java.lang.Void> writeCommand(GattService onGattService,
                                                  java.util.UUID identifier,
                                                  GattPeripheral.WriteType writeType,
                                                  byte[] payload,
                                                  OperationTimeout timeout)
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Writes a given payload to a characteristic belonging to a service on the peripheral.

        Important: it appears on some devices that writes are asynchronous on multiple levels. Although the stack may report the write was successful, it doesn't mean the write has actually completed. If you're going to disconnect after a write operation, it's a good idea to add a delay of a few seconds.

        The value of writeType is supposed to be automatically inferred during service discovery, but some devices do not consistently populate the value (Verizon Note 4). As such, this value must be provided for every write command call.

        Specified by:
        writeCommand in interface GattPeripheral
        Parameters:
        onGattService - The service to write to.
        identifier - The characteristic to write to.
        writeType - The type of write to perform.
        payload - The payload to write. Must be 20 bytes or less.
        timeout - The timeout to wrap the operation within.
        Returns:
        An observable that will emit a single null value, then complete upon success.

      • setPacketHandler

        public void setPacketHandler(GattPeripheral.PacketHandler dataHandler)
        Description copied from interface: GattPeripheral
        Associates a given packet handler with the GattPeripheral.

        Characteristic read and change data will be sent to the packet handler for processing, and outward propagation.

        While it is not required that you provide a packet handler, it is strongly recommended.

        Specified by:
        setPacketHandler in interface GattPeripheral

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a printable representation of this object.
